audiences.description: A 3MM audience of young, urban, and digitally active U.S. consumers beginning their oral care journey. Point of Market Entry: Starting Out skews Gen Z with an average age of 26, balancing new independence and early family life. They seek trusted guidance from peers and healthcare professionals, value affordability, and are motivated by promotions and convenience. Shopping primarily at Amazon and Target, they are high-value opportunities for brand trial through personalized offers and digital engagement.

shoppingBehaviors.text: Very important on social media to receive exclusive offers/coupons/discounts
Free spirited shopper
Will switch brands to use a coupon
Personal care new product seeker
Subscribe or auto-shipment personal care customer

skincareConcerns: Guidance from family/friends on health and hygiene (131i)
Online information about products and routines (131i)
luxury: Occasional premium experiences when value is clear
Upgraded entertainment or travel for special occasions

audiences.name: Point of Market Entry: Starting Out
personaQuotes: I’m just starting to build my own oral care routine, so I look to friends and doctors to tell me what actually works.
If there’s a good deal online at Amazon or Target, that’s when I’ll try something new like mouthwash or a whitening toothpaste.
audiences.imageDescription: A young Gen Z consumer in an urban apartment bathroom, phone on the counter and toothpaste, toothbrush, and mouthwash visible, representing the Point of Market Entry: Starting Out oral care audience in the USA.

shared: Shopping videos on TikTok and Instagram
Buys via social platforms when offered deals
owned: Email engagement and direct mail offers

audiences.description: An 8.2MM audience of affluent, family-oriented U.S. consumers who once trusted Listerine but have shifted away. Predominantly Gen X and Boomers, they balance active wellness routines with leisure and travel. Their shopping is driven by convenience and familiarity, with Amazon and mass retailers as key touchpoints. They respond to credible recommendations and premium natural product offerings, staying connected through streaming, email, and social engagement.

shoppingBehaviors.text: Convenience-driven personal care shopper
Personal care new product seeker
Brand-motivated personal care product user
Premium natural personal care product user
Stock up shopper

skincareConcerns: Premium and natural personal care product users (147i)
Sensitive to efficacy and recommendation from professionals (129i)
fitness: All-around sports enthusiasts across soccer, football, baseball, hockey, golf, NASCAR, and basketball

audiences.name: Listerine Lapsed

demographics.incomeOver250k: 73% earn more than $100K annually; 25% earn more than $200K

personaQuotes: We already know which brands work for our family, but we’ll upgrade if the benefits and health claims are clear.
Convenience matters most—if I can stock up on trusted products at Amazon or a club store, that’s where I’ll go.
audiences.imageDescription: A midlife consumer in a family bathroom with mouthwash, electric toothbrushes, and premium personal care products arranged neatly, representing the Listerine Lapsed audience in the USA.

shared: Shares recommendations with family and friends
Engages with brand and retailer content around health and wellness

audiences.description: A digitally active, relationship-centered UK audience balancing work, family, and wellness. Wellness Enthusiasts value practical beauty, hygiene, and lifestyle tips, and respond strongly to celebrity-led media. They shop mainly at Tesco and Aldi, buying brands like L'Oréal, Nivea, and Dove, while following influencers such as Jasmine Lovell and Chloe Sims for relatable inspiration.

shoppingBehaviors.text: Not the principal shopper of the household
Cosmetic products buyer
Buys baby products
Skincare and haircare brand loyalist (L'Oreal, Nivea, Dove, Tresemme, Lynx, Head & Shoulders)

purchaseInfluences.text: I enjoy watching ads featuring my favorite celebrities
I often notice products or brands that appear in TV programs and films
I always buy vegan products where possible

skincareConcerns: Oral hygiene and bad breath solutions
entertainment: Enjoys TV programs and films featuring recognizable brands
luxury: Occasional premium beauty and personal care purchases when value is clear
Interest in practical but effective cosmetic upgrades
travel: Family-oriented outings and everyday local travel for work and school
Practical trips that fit around work–life balance
fitness: Cooking at home (68%, 100i) as part of a balanced lifestyle
Wellness-focused routines for self and family

audiences.name: Wellness Enthusiast
personaQuotes: I’m always looking for simple tips that make family life, hygiene, and beauty feel more manageable.
If a celebrity I like uses a product and it fits my routine and budget, I’m very likely to try it.
audiences.imageDescription: A UK parent in a cozy kitchen and bathroom setting, juggling work and family life, with everyday personal care brands like L'Oreal, Nivea, and Dove visible on the counter, representing the Wellness Enthusiast audience.

shared: Social media conversations influenced by celebrities
Word-of-mouth sharing of beauty and hygiene tips
Online discussions of TV and film product placements
owned: I often notice products or brands that appear in TV programs and films (14%, 173i)
I always buy vegan products where possible (15%, 157i)
Brand and retailer content that reinforces healthy routines and practical tips

audiences.description: A digitally engaged, mid-income UK parent audience blending practicality and tech-savviness. Ortho Conscious Parents are predominantly partnered and family-centered, consuming content around parenting, hygiene, and everyday life. They value authenticity, notice ads in podcasts and news media, and are open to guidance that simplifies family routines. Key retailers include Amazon Fresh and ASDA, with strong affinity toward Pampers, Burt’s Bees, and Johnson’s Baby.

shoppingBehaviors.text: Not the principal shopper of the household
Family-focused shopper prioritizing baby and personal care products
Digitally savvy, using Vinted and online platforms for value and convenience

purchaseInfluences.text: I often notice products or brands that appear in TV programs and films
I often notice ads in newspapers and magazines
Ads in podcasts improve my perception of the brand

skincareConcerns: Oral hygiene and bad breath solutions for the family
Routines for age-optimizing and everyday wellness
Product safety and suitability for kids
entertainment: Coding and computing as hobbies (coding 14%, 174i; computing 20%, 130i)
luxury: Occasional premium baby and family products (Pampers, Burt’s Bees, Johnson's Baby)
Willingness to pay more for trusted brands with clear benefits
travel: Family-oriented outings and short trips that fit around work
fitness: Balanced lifestyle that mixes screen time with outdoor activity

audiences.name: Ortho Conscious Parents

ageDistribution.Gen Z: Younger parents at the start of family life

personaQuotes: I’m always looking for practical advice that makes parenting and hygiene easier for the whole family.
If a product is recommended by people I trust and fits our budget, I’ll try it—especially for my kids.
audiences.imageDescription: A UK parent in a modern home juggling kids and work, with baby products, toothpaste, and mouthwash on the counter, browsing on a phone for parenting tips and product reviews, representing the Ortho Conscious Parents audience.

shared: Shares and discusses parenting and product content on social media
Relatable parenting moments and hygiene tips in online communities
owned: Ads in podcasts improve perception of the brand (27%, 505i)
Brand and retailer content focused on parenting advice and routines

audiences.description: A 36.5MM audience of young, early-jobber Chinese consumers who are digitally savvy and socially engaged. Social Strivers (Solution Seekers) follow the latest trends, shop heavily online, and constantly seek ways to elevate their lifestyle and image. They embrace self-care and oral care as part of becoming their best selves, leaning into fun content, beauty, and influencer-led recommendations.

shoppingBehaviors.text: Early jobbers focused on career growth (#Earlyjobber)
Social, digitally savvy, and always online (#Socialdigitalsavvy)
Willing to try new products with quality (#Willingtotrynewthings)

purchaseInfluences.text: Salesperson recommendations at point of sale

skincareConcerns: Self-care and oral care as part of becoming their best selves
Interest in products with perceived quality and efficacy
entertainment: Shopping as a social leisure activity (112i)
Fun video content, beauty, ACG, and celebrity-driven content
luxury: Lifestyle upgrades through beauty, fashion, and personal care
Spending on experiences that enhance image and social presence
travel: Exploring urban and nearby destinations for content creation
fitness: Active social lifestyles that mix entertainment, gaming, and light outdoor activity
Attention to routines that support looking and feeling their best

audiences.name: POME: Social Strivers (Solution Seekers)

demographics.kids: Not specified; more likely pre-family or early family stage
demographics.collegeGraduate: Not specified, but skewing toward educated early-career professionals

personaQuotes: I value my career development and growth (59%, 120i).
I’m willing to try new products with quality (68%, 116i).
audiences.imageDescription: A young Chinese professional in a modern apartment, browsing short video apps and e-commerce platforms on their phone, with beauty, oral care products, and lifestyle items on the desk, representing the Social Strivers POME audience.

shared: Friends and family recommendations around new products
Social sharing of fun videos, beauty, ACG, and celebrity content
Short video comments and engagement on Douyin

audiences.description: A 30.4MM audience of career-driven Chinese individuals who are pragmatic in their consumption. Health Fixers (Fresh Aspirers) favor supermarkets and e-commerce for personal care, making deliberate choices that prioritize brands and services delivering tangible wellness benefits. They seek professional advice, enjoy relaxing experiences, and aspire to live a healthy, more organic lifestyle.

shoppingBehaviors.text: Pragmatic achievers focused on results (#Pragmaticachievers)
Wellness seekers who value relaxation and health (#Wellnessseekers)
Seek product recommendations from experts (#Professionaladviceseeking)

purchaseInfluences.text: Products recommended by experts are usually trustworthy

skincareConcerns: Products recommended by experts are usually trustworthy (43%, 107i)
Aspire to live an organic and healthy lifestyle (57%, 106i)
Care about tangible health and wellness benefits, including oral care
entertainment: Short drama and product recommendation content
luxury: Enjoying products or services that help them relax (44%, 108i)
Upgrading personal care and wellness routines through trusted premium options
travel: Travel content and planning as a form of leisure inspiration
fitness: Wellness routines that support long-term health

audiences.name: POME: Health Fixers (Fresh Aspirers)

demographics.collegeGraduate: Not specified, but skewing toward working professionals

personaQuotes: I hope to reach the pinnacle of my career (60%, 113i).
I am passionate about enjoying products or services that help me relax (44%, 108i).
Products recommended by experts are usually trustworthy (43%, 107i).
I aspire to live an organic and healthy lifestyle (57%, 106i).
audiences.imageDescription: A mid-career Chinese professional relaxing at home after work, browsing e-commerce and short video platforms for wellness and personal care products, with supermarket and club-store branded items on the table, representing the Health Fixers POME audience.

shared: Friends and family recommendations for wellness and personal care products
Online discussions about TV drama, short drama, and product recommendations
Social sharing of travel, park, and theme park experiences
owned: Offline brand events focused on wellness and relaxation
